title: Web 1 Depreciation
custom_preconds:
As of January 15, 2018, Web 1 will be going away. The following domains are being depreciated:
- gdx.mlb.com (off by Feb 21)
- mlb.mlb.com
- wap*.mlb.com
(exception to the above: "lookup" will be safe)

Depreciated endpoints and the new URL's iOS is using can be found here: 
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10nmzmPQaLOd0N77l-0k1JYieE8zDodvts--A0_ssK7U/edit#gid=295149657

Per Jared Ravich:
The files on gdx are going away, but clients wonâ€™t know the difference because the API is configured with lambda functions that emulate the output of all legacy files. The server will return those results when the old URLs are hit there, so the change will be invisible. Your applications should be able to continue relying on all DFA-generated data there.
All CMS mashups that generate data to the MiLB webmount are being forklifted and the files that have been generated previously should move as well. The mashup that was created for the MiLB.tv grid and schedules is slated for doom

title: Future compatibility for GDX scoreboard endpoint
custom_preconds:
Per Michael Luton:
My understanding is that everything currently available at GDX will continue to be available, but no new updates to the GDX endpoints will happen for the 2018 season games.

Old Endpoints for scoreboard: 
http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/$[sportCode]/year_$[yyyy]/month_$[mm]/day_$[dd]/scoreboard_android.xml

Note: 2018 and beyond will use Sports Data API endpoints.
Sport codes can be found here: http://qa-statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/sports
custom_steps: WHEN the application code is updated
custom_expected:
THEN 

- all years up to 2017 use the old GDX endpoints: http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/$[sportCode]/year_$[yyyy]/month_$[mm]/day_$[dd]/scoreboard_android.xml

- 2018 and beyond use new GDX endpoints: http://qa-statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?date=$[mm]/$[dd]/$[yyyy]&sportId=$[sportCode]

i.e. 
QA - http://qa-statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?date=05/17/2016&sportId=11
PROD - http://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?hydrate=decisions,probablePitcher,broadcasts(all),game(content(all)),linescore(matchup,runners,positions),stats,person,team,flags&date=09/19/2017&sportId=11

title: ??? Future compatibility for GDX video highlights endpoint_Not being used on the app????
custom_preconds:
Per Michael Luton:
My understanding is that everything currently available at GDX will continue to be available, but no new updates to the GDX endpoints will happen for the 2018 season games.

Old Endpoints for videohighlights / videohighlightsDEV / videohighlightsTEST: 
http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/year_$[yyyy]/month_$[mm]/day_$[dd]/gid_$[gameid]/media/mobile.xml

Note: 2018 and beyond will use Sports Data API endpoints.
custom_steps: When the application code is updated
custom_expected:
THEN

- all years up to 2017 use the old GDX videohighlights, videohighlightsDEV, and videohighlightsTEST endpoints: http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/year_$[yyyy]/month_$[mm]/day_$[dd]/gid_$[gameid]/media/mobile.xml

- 2018 and beyond use new videohighlights, videohighlightsDEV, and videohighlightsTEST GDX endpoints:
 https://content.mlb.com/app/mlb/mobile/components/game/${sportCode}/year_${yyyy}/month_${mm}/day_${dd}/gid_${gamedayId}/media/mobile.xml

title: ??? Future compatibility for GDX expanded video highlights endpoint_Not being used in the app???
custom_preconds:
Per Michael Luton:
My understanding is that everything currently available at GDX will continue to be available, but no new updates to the GDX endpoints will happen for the 2018 season games.

Old Endpoints for expandedvideohighlights / expandedvideohighlightsDEV / expandedvideohighlightsTEST: http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/year_$[yyyy]/month_$[mm]/day_$[dd]/gid_$[gameid]/media/instadium.xml

Note: 2018 and beyond will use Sports Data API endpoints.
custom_steps: WHEN the application code is updated
custom_expected:
THEN 

- all years up to 2017 use the old expandedvideohighlights, expandedvideohighlightsDEV: expandedvideohighlightsTEST GDX endpoints: http://gdx.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/year_$[yyyy]/month_$[mm]/day_$[dd]/gid_$[gameid]/media/instadium.xml
- 2018 and beyond use new GDX endpoints: ???????

title: Future compatibility for GDX MiLB.tv grid endpoint
custom_preconds:
Per Michael Luton:
My understanding is that everything currently available at GDX will continue to be available, but no new updates to the GDX endpoints will happen for the 2018 season games.

Old Endpoints for milbtvgrid: 
http://www.milb.com/gen/mashup/epg/year_$[yyyy]/month_$[mm]/day_$[dd]/milbtvgrid.json

Note: 2018 and beyond will use Sports Data API endpoints.
custom_steps:
WHEN the application code is updated
AND user views the MiLB.tv grid
custom_expected:
THEN 

- all years up to 2017 could use the old GDX endpoints: 
http://www.milb.com/gen/mashup/epg/year_$[yyyy]/month_$[mm]/day_$[dd]/milbtvgrid.json
but they can use the new one endpoint too (new endpoint below)

- 2018 and beyond use new GDX endpoints: 
i.e. http://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?hydrate=decisions,probablePitcher,broadcasts(all),game(content(all)),linescore(matchup,runners,positions),stats,person,team,flags&date=09/15/2017&sportId=11

title: Clean Out Unused Code
custom_preconds: Clean out unused and legacy code from the First Pitch android app.
custom_steps: WHEN the unused code is no longer in the First Pitch android app.
custom_expected: THEN this should have no impact on the current functionality.

title: Update CVS endpoints to AWS Pre-September
custom_preconds:
The following endpoints were forklifted pre-January 15, 2018, but will need to migrate to AWS before September 2018. Once new endpoints are available, update the app to the new locations.

http://wap.milb.com/milb/android/standings/
http://wap.milb.com/milb/android/stats
http://wap.mlb.com/mlb_tv?device=android&app=atbat
http://wap.mlb.com/atbat/android/faq/?y=2013
http://wap.mlb.com/%s/ipadpregame/v2
http://wap.mlb.com/%s/androidtabletsummary/
http://wapc.mlb.com/gd3/apps/native/androidTablet.jsp#gameId=gid_%s,loc=%s,view=%s
http://wap.mlb.com/atbat/android/player/%s/
http://wap.mlb.com/atbat/android/faq/?y=2013
http://wap.mlb.com/atbat/android/faq/?y=2013
http://wap.milb.com/milb/android/privacy?ref=@applicationReference@
http://wapqa.milb.com/milb/android/standings/

title: GSA to BAM Elastic Search
custom_preconds: Due to contractual obligations, we'll need to migrate any GSA calls to BAM Elastic Search

title: Update Video Search Service to Point to BAM Elastic Search
custom_preconds:
We will be replacing the search endpoints currently being served by GSA with BAM Elastic Search.
James Boehmer will provide the necessary endpoints for the Android team to point to.
We will need to replace video highlights by class and by club. Please advise, PM (via the dev) if there are other video search endpoints beyond class and club.

title: Update News Search Service to Point to BAM Elastic Search
custom_preconds:
We will be replacing the search endpoints currently being served by GSA with BAM Elastic Search.
James Boehmer will provide the necessary endpoints for the Android team to point to.
We will need to replace news/press releases by class and by club. Please advise, PM (via the dev) if there are other news search endpoints powered by GSA beyond class and club.

title: Update All Other Search Service to Point to BAM Elastic Search
custom_preconds:
This ticket is for any other non-news or -video endpoints in the First Pitch app currently powered by GSA.
We will be replacing the search endpoints currently being served by GSA with BAM Elastic Search.
James Boehmer will provide the necessary endpoints for the Android team to point to.
Please advise, PM (via the dev) what (if any) non-news or -video endpoints are currently powered by GSA.
